alert.note: Alert for Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 6:17PM CDT until April 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Christian, Douglas, Ozark, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Howell Creek at County Road 9790. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain Grove, Ava, Mountain View, Thayer, Willow Springs, Rogersville and Cabool. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
